```{r, include=FALSE}

  results='asis', 
  echo = FALSE

library(tidyverse)
library(glue)
library(magrittr) # For the pipe
source("cv_printing_functions.r")

CV <- create_CV_object(
  data_location = "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1D_MQxoi1XXoQLWSI3mH1Qo6tkctnENAij0-d3BEohu0",  
  pdf_mode = params$pdf_mode
)

# skills <- CV$skills
```


```{r, include=FALSE}
# Now we just need to filter down the position data to include less verbose
# categories and only the entries we have designated for the resume
CV$entries_data <- CV$entries_data %>% 
  filter(in_resume == "TRUE") %>% 
  mutate(
    # Build some custom sections by collapsing others
    section = case_when(
      section %in% c('research_positions', 'teaching_positions') ~ 'positions', 
      section %in% c('academic_articles', 'scientific_comms') ~ 'scicomms',
      TRUE ~ section
    )
  ) 
# fix descriptions so only get 1 level
CV$entries_data <- CV$entries_data %>% 
  rowwise() %>% 
  mutate(description_bullets=ifelse(section == 'positions',
                                    str_split(description_bullets,"\n")[[1]][1],
                                    description_bullets)) %>% 
  ungroup()
```
